Description: Pottery bowl, completely preserved apart from chip at rim; recessed base, incised groove around rim. Very micaceous, red-brown Nile silt clay, sandy texture on surface, some lime inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Well 94 (= Well 3) or Well 96 (= Well 4)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

scratched number '94' probably refers to findspot well 94 (=well 3) in temenos of Apollo; probably the piece illustrated in Petrie 1886, pl. XVII.8, even though this is said to come from well 96. Apparently not listed in EEF Philadelphia distribution list in EES archive. Petrie 1886, pl. XVII.8 (?). If example depicted, then this should be from well 96. Parallel found in Ptolemaic levels in Kom Hadid (Leonard 2001, 72-3, fig.2.12, no.2), though this may be residual.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XVII, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.100)
